p: Limonene 19 is the most important and most abundant monoterpene in nature. It is the main ingredient of many essential oils obtained from citrus fruits. Its content in some cases reaches almost 90–95%, hence, they are its main source. Given the enormous amounts of citrus fruits processed into juice each year, limonene production is measured in tens of thousands of tons. It is obtained by steam distillation of the residue from this process. It has a pleasant lemon scent. In the food industry, limonene contained in essential oils is used as a flavouring in the production of desserts, ice cream and non-alcoholic beverages. One of the new trends is adding pure terpenes to cocktails—limonene is among them [ 61].
